Hello, I apologize for delays, I had been very distracted by many things including some paperwork for personal bureaucracy and also... helping hash out with everyone about an entirely new model for how Rust works regarding pointers: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/95228

This will probably have some impact on our models for our more niche code/types.
It would be v. funny to me if vectors of pointers are actually more sound than pointers alone because all of their operations follow strict provenance as closely as possible.
waves a sign that says "usize was a mistake" around
Naw, ByteSize that's actually the return type of size_of with intptr_t: From<ByteSize> and ptrdiff_t: From<ByteSize> because it's only 63-bit on 64-bit machines.
